meanings.definition: Demand as a right or due
meanings.sent1: The teacher exacts respect from all students.
meanings.sent2: The landlord exacts rent from tenants every month.
meanings.sent3: The cat exacts treats by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The dictator exacts obedience through fear.
meanings.sent5: The king exacts loyalty from his subjects.

meanings.definition: To require as payment or performance
meanings.sent1: The company exacts a fee for their services.
meanings.sent2: The coach exacts dedication from the players.
meanings.sent3: The toddler exacts attention by throwing tantrums.
meanings.sent4: The storm exacts a toll on the fragile roof.
meanings.sent5: The task exacts precision to be completed successfully.

meanings.definition: To obtain by force or authority
meanings.sent1: The thief exacts valuables from unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent2: The conqueror exacts tribute from the defeated nation.
meanings.sent3: The bully exacts lunch money from weaker kids.
meanings.sent4: The vampire exacts blood from its prey.
meanings.sent5: The pirate exacts treasure from captured ships.
